image.altText: A close-up of a man speaking.

items.synopsis: Hamas's head of international relations Dr Basem Naim says the terrorist group's plan was never to target civilians when militants attacked Southern Israel on October 7.

title.children: Hamas senior leader says there were no plans to target civilians in Israel attack

image.altText: Two men stand with their heads in their hands. A young boy stands in front of them.

items.synopsis: Look back on the latest updates as King Abdullah II of Jordan says neither Jordan nor Egypt are willing to accept any Palestinian refugees.

title.children: Jordan and Egypt unwilling to accept Palestinian refugees as organisations call for urgent access to deliver aid to Gaza — as it happened

image.altText: Injuries to a police officer following an alleged assault.

items.synopsis: A failed South Australian Senate candidate and anti-vaccine protester standing trial for assaulting a female police officer will argue she was attempting to free herself from an "unlawful" arrest, a court hears.

title.children: Woman accused of 'pulling actual clumps of hair' out of police officer's scalp pleads not guilty

image.altText: Logos of the University of South Australia and University of Adelaide.

items.synopsis: Merging South Australia's two biggest universities would create "significant opportunities" for the state — but the committee evaluating the proposal also identified 116 risks.

title.children: SA uni merger given green light by parliamentary inquiry, despite 116 potential risks

image.altText: A man with a beard and wearing a suit jacket.

items.synopsis: Muslim community leader Ahmed Zreika quits his board membership with the SA Multicultural Commission in protest against the state government's stance on the Israel-Gaza war, which he says has been characterised by anti-Palestinian bias.

title.children: Multicultural leader quits over SA government's response to Israel-Gaza war

image.altText: Couple standing on a rocky landscape.

items.synopsis: Blake Jory grew up in Noosa. Last year on a European holiday, he fell in love with an Israeli woman. Now he's experienced war firsthand and his partner is soon off to the front line.

title.children: Australian man's romance lands him in the middle of Israel-Gaza war

image.altText: Australian journalist Cheng Lei, who was arrested and jailed in China three years ago, has released

items.synopsis: Australian journalist Cheng Lei speaks publicly for the first time since landing back in Australia last week.

title.children: Australian journalist detained for three years in China was accused of breaching media embargo

image.altText: Peter Greste speaking at the National Press Club

items.synopsis: An Australian journalist who spent 400 days imprisoned in an Egyptian jail on terrorism charges is calling for media freedom to be enshrined in Australia's constitution — but concedes it's unlikely to ever eventuate.

title.children: Peter Greste wants a Media Freedom Act, but doubts Australians can be convinced

image.altText: a man named Michael Landis with a young child strapped to his chest stands next to his wife at Sydney airport

items.synopsis: The first chartered repatriation flight to arrive in Australia from Israel since war broke out in the Middle Eastern country arrives in Sydney.

title.children: First Australian repatriation flight from Israel lands in Sydney, carrying 222 passengers

image.altText: Five people standing in a asia grocery store. Man in the middle wearing red tinged glasses.

items.synopsis: Annie Liban had no idea actor Nicolas Cage was shooting a movie in WA until he walked through the doors of her small Asian grocery store.

title.children: 'You look like Nicolas Cage': Shop owner's suspicions confirmed as Hollywood actor browses Busselton

image.altText: A huge ball of flames and smoke rises in the distance acoss a body of water near Kempsey in NSW

items.synopsis: Residents of northern NSW are struggling through a second day of severe bushfires, with two blazes at Watch and Act level and a fire at Byron Bay inching closer to homes.

title.children: One man killed as Northern Rivers bushfire intensifies, heads for beach community

image.altText: a woman in a gamer tshirt looking at the camera

items.synopsis: Chantal Ryan, who will speak at international convention South by Southwest, is using her platform to inspire and support other women to get involved in gaming.

title.children: More diversity needed in booming gaming industry, Adelaide designer says

image.altText: An aboriginal woman wearing a white singlet standing inside a house.

items.synopsis: South Australian Aboriginal leaders are calling for the community to learn from the referendum result and come together following the campaign.

title.children: No SA federal electorate is projected to have voted Yes. Here's how Aboriginal leaders are responding

image.altText: A man and woman shake hands.

items.synopsis: Fiji's Prime Minister Sitiveni Rabuka uses a speech in Canberra to call for a "Zone of Peace" in the Pacific, urging the US and China to step back from their intensifying contest for influence in the region.

title.children: Fiji's PM once led a coup and was known as 'Rambo'. He's now calling for a 'Zone of Peace' in the Pacific

image.altText: Vladimir Putin emerges from a pack of men in suits, looking proud of himself

items.synopsis: Vladimir Putin is making a rare visit to China for his "dear friend" Xi Jinping's Belt and Road summit. Seen as something of a social pariah on the global stage, and facing war crimes charges over his assault on Ukraine, what do he and Xi stand to gain from this visit?

title.children: Putin has landed in one of the only places he won't be arrested. Here's what he and Xi could be looking to achieve

image.altText: A bearded man wearing sunglasses holds a rainbow LGBT flag aloft.

items.synopsis: India's top court says it cannot legalise same-sex marriages, with the chief justice of the country saying making such a law is the domain of parliament.

title.children: India's top court declines to legally recognise same-sex marriage

image.altText: A defaced electoral sign.

items.synopsis: Of the many lessons of Saturday's referendum on the Voice to Parliament, there is one which must be more urgently addressed — our appetite for mistruths, writes Linton Besser.

title.children: With the lies and disinformation of Voice referendum exposed, Australia is sleepwalking towards the future

image.altText: A man stares down the barrel of a camera while sitting in a room, wearing all black.

items.synopsis: Alex Ophel, who is facing two charges of attempted murder for allegedly stabbing two women at the Australian National University, will undergo psychiatric assessment before his case returns to court.

title.children: Canberra man facing two attempted murder charges for alleged ANU stabbing to undergo psychiatric assessment

image.altText: The outside of the Toowoomba Court

items.synopsis: Lawyers for a high-profile man charged with rape west of Brisbane have formally appealed a court's decision to allow his identity to be revealed

title.children: Judge grants stay of non-publication order for high-profile man accused of rape in Toowoomba

image.altText: An old colour photo of a young man sitting in bushland with no shirt on

items.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the 43-year-old's death has heard he told a close friend he was in trouble before mysteriously going missing in 2021.

title.children: NT coroner hears Katherine man Shane Tapp bought machete, balaclava before going missing

image.altText: Naomi Watts wearing a white shirt and sunglasses with short blonde hair

items.synopsis: Academy award-nominated actor Naomi Watts was in her mid-thirties when she had tests revealing she was close to menopause. Now, she wants this generation to be the last to experience shame around menopause.

title.children: 'The last generation to have shame about it': Naomi Watts on reshaping the narrative around menopause

image.altText: three women stand side by side smiling at the camera

items.synopsis: Members of a fitness group in WA's north have been given bravery awards after they saved a young child from an alleged attempted drowning by his father last month.

title.children: 'We were meant to be there': Dampier women who saved child from alleged drowning attempt given bravery awards

image.altText: Pro-Palestinian protesters are seen during a rally in Hyde Park Sydney. Palestinian flag in centre of frame

items.synopsis: A 63-year-old man is arrested in Sydney's west after allegedly making offensive comments at the rally in Hyde Park at the weekend.

title.children: Man charged over 'offensive language' at Sydney pro-Palestinian rally

image.altText: A person with dark skin wearing a beanie with their head resting in a their hand.

items.synopsis: The grief-stricken grandmothers of a First Nations teenager clinging to life after apparently trying to take his own life inside a notorious youth detention unit say they feel like he was "sent to a big meat house and came back slaughtered".

title.children: 'He had dreams': Heartbroken family of 16yo on life support say he just wanted to return home

image.altText: a bushfire at night, with the whole scene lit up red, sparks flying.

items.synopsis: Backburns have been put in place with the aim of stopping the fire before it moves from scrubland into the Barkly's open plains, which are some of the NT's most productive cattle country.

title.children: Hopes backburning will slow NT fire that has burnt more than 2.8 million hectares

image.altText: NSW Premier Chris Minns and Federal Minister for Indigenous Australians Linda Burney pictured at a Voice polling booth in Sydney

items.synopsis: While New South Wales has the biggest Indigenous population, it's the only state or territory not to have already started the treaty process. So what might a treaty look like in the state and what happens from here?

title.children: NSW will push on with First Nations treaty despite Voice referendum's defeat. Here's what it means

image.altText: A photo of a young boy in a broken frame, draped in a Western Bulldogs scarf

items.synopsis: Adam Kneale has accused the Western Bulldogs of turning a blind eye to a sexual predator who preyed on young boys at the club four decades ago.

title.children: Victim wants to 'send a message' by taking AFL club to court over sexual abuse

image.altText: Soccer fans in Belgian flags in the stands of a stadium. A man and woman hugging tightly

items.synopsis: The suspected shooter has been shot hours after a manhunt began in Brussels.

title.children: Police shoot dead suspected extremist accused of killing two Swedish soccer fans in Brussels

image.altText: A black and white image of a crowd with a teenage Natalie in the front, looking up at the stage

items.synopsis: Natalie Imbruglia's childhood dream was to become a star. While realising that dream brought unexpected curve balls, she says she wouldn't do anything differently.

title.children: How one of Australia's biggest pop exports plotted her journey from girl in the INXS crowd to star on stage

image.altText: blowfly

items.synopsis: Early warm weather has triggered a bumper season for Australia's 30,000 fly species. So who are these curious insects, and how should we think about their presence in our lives?

title.children: With fly season underway in Australia, get to know our most common species and how to keep them away

image.altText: Dwayne Johnstone, with his step-mother, father and partner

items.synopsis: A court has heard a correctional officer "believed he was doing what was necessary to prevent escape" when he shot and killed inmate Dwayne Johnstone outside a hospital in northern NSW.

title.children: Defence argues 'reasonable grounds' for fatal shooting as correctional officer tried for murder

image.altText: A soldier in military uniform and helmet looks out from a covered position, as sun shines in through holes in a camouflage tarp

items.synopsis: Ukraine says Russia is running out of steam in some areas, but fighting in other locations has "significantly escalated".

title.children: Russia's invasion of Ukraine reaches 600 days, as fighting escalates in key areas

image.altText: A man and woman look at paperwork while sitting at an outdoor wooden table

items.synopsis: The competition between mortgage lenders to get your business could soon be heating up again, analysts say, as the nation's largest lender loses market share for the first time in five years.

title.children: Will we soon see 'mortgage wars' part two as the nation's biggest bank bleeds customers?

image.altText: A peregrine falcon in a nest box feeds her two fluffy white chicks.

items.synopsis: For the past 15 years, falcon lovers around the world have watched on with joy and at times heartbreak at the private lives of a peregrine falcon family live streamed for a university project.

title.children: 'No filter, no editing': Global audience hooked as falcon family welcomes new chicks
